sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个情态动词均含有"能，可能，可以"之意。
means: 1.can表示体力或智力方面的能力。may没有这种功能。
2.can和may都可表示请求允许做某事，前者较口语化，最常用；may用于正式文体，多含尊敬之意。
3.can和may都可能表示可能性，前者表理论上的可能性，而后者表示现实的可能性。在这种用法中，can一般不能用来表将来的可能性，多用在否定和疑问句中表现在的可能性，而may既可表现在又可表将来的可能性。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"罐头"之意。
means: can ： 为美国英语，现在英国也用。

word_mean: 外壳，外皮;= cancel,【ASCII】作废符，取消符

sentence.Network_en: The happiest are not those who own all the best things, but those who can appreciate the beauty of life.
sentence.Network_cn: 最幸福的人们并不一定什么都是最好，只是他们懂得欣赏生活的美好。

sentence.Network_en: You have to do everything you can. You have to work your hardest. And if you do, if you stay positive, then you have a shot at a silver lining.
sentence.Network_cn: 你必须全力以赴，最大限度地去努力。如果你这么做，并且保持乐观，你就会看见乌云背后的幸福线。

sentence.Network_en: You can improve your chances of profit by sensible planning.
sentence.Network_cn: 你可以通过合理计划来提高盈利的机会。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cunnan 'know' (in Middle English 'know how to'), related to Dutch kunnen and German können; from an Indo-European root shared by Latin gnoscere 'know' and Greek gignōskein 'know'
Old English canne, related to Dutch kan and German Kanne; either of Germanic origin or from late Latin canna

encyclopedia.content: can是一个英文词汇，一般表示能或可以的意思。也用作一些词汇的简写或地名代码。

entry.tran: (表示某事物的特点)能够，可以
entry.def: You use can when you are mentioning a quality or fact about something which people may make use of if they want to.

example.ex: Pork is also the most versatile of meats. It can be roasted whole or in pieces...
example.tran: 在肉类中,猪肉的做法也是最多的,可以整块烤来吃,也可以切片烤来吃。

example.ex: Luckily, iron can be reworked and mistakes don't have to be thrown away...
example.tran: 所幸的是,铁可以再加工,次品、废品不必被扔掉。

entry.tran: (表示有能力或机会)能，会，可以
entry.def: You use can to indicate that someone has the ability or opportunity to do something.

example.ex: Don't worry yourself about me, I can take care of myself...
example.tran: 你别担心我,我能照顾好自己。

example.ex: I can't give you details because I don't actually have any details...
example.tran: 我没办法给你提供细节,因为我并不了解任何细节。

entry.tran: (用于否定句，表示情况不允许)不能，无法
entry.def: You use cannot to indicate that someone is not able to do something because circumstances make it impossible for them to do it.

example.ex: People who can't afford to go to the theatre or concerts can afford to go to football matches...
example.tran: 看不起电影或听不起音乐会的人可以去观看足球赛。

example.ex: We cannot buy food, clothes and pay for rent and utilities on $20 a week...
example.tran: 一个星期才20美元,不够我们吃穿、付房租及水电等费用的。

entry.def: You use can to indicate that something is true sometimes or is true in some circumstances.

example.ex: ...long-term therapy that can last five years or more...
example.tran: 有可能持续5年乃至更长时间的长期治疗。

example.ex: A vacant lot or a bombsite can, to the amateur naturalist, produce an extraordinary variety of flora and fauna...
example.tran: 对于业余博物学者来说,在一片空地上或被炸后的废墟里可能发现种类繁多的植物群和动物群。

entry.tran: (用于否定句，表示确信某事不真实或不会发生)不可能，不会
entry.def: You use cannot and can't to state that you are certain that something is not the case or will not happen.

example.ex: From her knowledge of Douglas's habits, she feels sure that the attacker can't have been Douglas...
example.tran: 根据她对道格拉斯习性的了解,她敢断定他不可能是那个袭击者。

example.ex: Things can't be that bad...
example.tran: 情况不会糟到那个地步。

entry.def: You use can to indicate that someone is allowed to do something. You use cannot or can't to indicate that someone is not allowed to do something.

example.ex: You must buy the credit life insurance before you can buy the disability insurance...
example.tran: 你必须先购买信用人寿保险,方可购买伤残保险。

example.ex: No-one can set up a waste disposal company unless they can show that they've got enough money and trained staff to do the job properly...
example.tran: 任何人若想成立废品处理公司,必须证明其拥有足够资金和受训员工以保证工作可以顺利开展。

entry.def: You use cannot or can't when you think it is very important that something should not happen or that someone should not do something.

example.ex: It is an intolerable situation and it can't be allowed to go on...
example.tran: 这种情况忍无可忍,不能再任其继续下去了。

example.ex: The Commission can't demand from Sweden more than it demands from its own members.
example.tran: 委员会对瑞典的要求不能比对自己的会员国要求都多。

entry.tran: (通常用于疑问句，表示建议或提议帮忙)能
entry.def: You use can, usually in questions, in order to make suggestions or to offer to do something.

example.ex: What can I do around here?...
example.tran: 我在这儿能做点儿什么?

example.ex: This old lady was struggling out of the train and I said, 'Oh, can I help you?'...
example.tran: 我看见这位老太太正颤巍巍地下火车,就问:“嗯,我来帮您一把吗?”

entry.tran: (用于疑问句时,can 表示礼貌的请求，而 can't 表示强烈请求）
entry.def: You use can in questions in order to make polite requests. You use can't in questions in order to request strongly that someone does something.

example.ex: Can I have a look at that?...
example.tran: 我能不能看一眼那个?

example.ex: Can you please help?...
example.tran: 请你帮个忙好吗?

entry.tran: (用于有礼貌地打断,或引导要说的话)能,可以
entry.def: You use can as a polite way of interrupting someone or of introducing what you are going to say next.

example.ex: Can I interrupt you just for a minute?...
example.tran: 我能不能打断你们一下?

example.ex: But if I can interrupt, Joe, I don't think anybody here is personally blaming you...
example.tran: 对不起,乔,我插一句,可我认为在座的没有谁在埋怨你。

entry.tran: (与 imagine, think, believe 等动词连用,用来加强语气)能
entry.def: You use can with verbs such as 'imagine', 'think', and 'believe' in order to emphasize how you feel about a particular situation.

example.ex: You can imagine he was terribly upset...
example.tran: 你能想象得出来,他当时心里乱得要命。

example.ex: You can't think how glad I was to see them all go...
example.tran: 你都想象不到,我看到他们全都走了,心里是多么高兴。

entry.tran: (与 how 一起用于疑问句,表示感受强烈)能,能够
entry.def: You use can in questions with 'how' to indicate that you feel strongly about something.

example.ex: How can you complain about higher taxes?...
example.tran: 你怎么能抱怨税费的提高呢?

example.ex: How can millions of dollars go astray?...
example.tran: 几百万美元怎么可能不翼而飞呢?

entry.tran: (盛放食品、饮料或油漆的)罐子，金属罐，听
entry.def: A can is a metal container in which something such as food, drink, or paint is put. The container is usually sealed to keep the contents fresh.

example.ex: Several young men were kicking a tin can along the middle of the road.
example.tran: 几个青年人踢着一个锡罐在路中间走着。

example.ex: ...empty beer cans.
example.tran: 空啤酒罐

entry.def: When food or drink is canned, it is put into a metal container and sealed so that it will remain fresh.

example.ex: ...fruits and vegetables that will be canned, skinned, diced or otherwise processed...
example.tran: 将要装罐、去皮、切块或用其他方法加工的水果和蔬菜

example.ex: It was always roast lamb and canned peas for Sunday lunch.
example.tran: 星期天午餐总是吃烤羔羊肉和豌豆罐头。

entry.def: If you are canned, you are dismissed from your job.

example.ex: The extremists prevailed, and the security minister was canned...
example.tran: 极端主义分子猖獗,致使安全部长被解职。

example.ex: When I got canned, I took these keys as souvenirs.
example.tran: 我被开除后,就拿了这些钥匙作为纪念。

entry.tran: 承担所有指责;代人受过
entry.def: If you have to carry the can, you have to take all the blame for something.

example.ex: We are a luxury restaurant and if people have a bad experience, we have to carry the can.
example.tran: 我们这是豪华饭店;如果客人用餐不愉快,背黑锅的就是我们。

entry.def: If you say that something such as a job that you are doing is in the can, you mean that it is completely finished.

example.ex: With another day's work in the can, Philip is happy to leave the open countryside and head for his London flat.
example.tran: 又干完了一天的活,菲利普满心愉悦地离开了广袤的乡村,前往自己位于伦敦的公寓。

means.word_mean: 1. airtight sealed metal container for food or drink or paint etc.
2. the quantity contained in a can
3. a buoy with a round bottom and conical top
4. the fleshy part of the human body that you sit on;

sentences.sentence: "he deserves a good kick in the butt"
"are you going to sit on your fanny and do nothing?"

means.word_mean: 5. a plumbing fixture for defecation and urination
6. a room equipped with toilet facilities
1. preserve in a can or tin;

example.en: It was I who opened a can of beans.
She was one of those people who like opening a can of beans.
example.zh: 她就是那种喜欢惹祸的人。

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)撬开保险柜的工具，万能钥匙
(军队用语)盛放烟蒂头的罐头盒

example.en: The thing's as easy as can be.

auth_sentence.content: Some people want to milk it all they can.

sentences.en: If you won't keep quiet you can get out!
sentences.cn: 如果你不保持安静, 那就只好请你出去了！

sentences.en: It can get quite cold here at night.
If you don't do your homework, you can leave the classroom.
sentences.cn: 你要是不做作业，就离开教室。

means.word_mean: [表示惊讶、不相信等]到底可能；居然会，竟至于；竟能

sentences.en: She can't be more than forty.
The fish is canned in this factory.
sentences.cn: 鱼是在这家工厂制成罐头的。

sentences.en: This can holds five liters of water.
My father opened a real can of worms when he took over the ailing company and tried to get it doing business.
sentences.cn: 当我父亲接管一家处境困难的公司并试图重振业务时, 他确实碰到了棘手的问题。

jushi.english: If you won't keep quiet you can get out!
jushi.chinese: 如果你不保持安静,那就只好请你出去了!

jushi.english: When a friend gave me a ticket,I can't help but go.
jushi.chinese: 一位朋友送给我一张票,我只好去了。
